front.title: Using approximate authentication with Secure Real-time Transport Protocol (SRTP)

abstract.t: This document describes how to use an approximate authentication algorithm in the Secure Real-time Transport Protocol (SRTP) to provide integrity protection for the Real-time Transport Protocol (RTP) traffic. Approximate authentication is a class of authentication algorithms where the authentication does not require the exact match of the source and received data, but a parameter given, certain amount of deviation is acceptable.
